page.title: 08Hospital Closure
page.content: Founded in 1885,{Bruntsfield Hospital is one hundred years old, but no one now feels like celebrating its {centenary.}It is waiting only for the Secretary of State to approve its closure. This hospital, founded by Edinburgh's first woman doctor, Sophia Jex-Blake, set out to care just for{women and {children.}Originally it was staffed entirely by women and has remained, throughout the years, extrememly popular with its patients, who liked its friendly, "family" atmosphere. Because of the cash crisis, the Lothian Health Board discussed the re-development of the{Royal Infirmary} to take over the work of the smaller hospitals. So has this hospital outlived its purpose? Some still believe that there is a case even yet for fighting for its survival.
